description: Two men were detained in the Kaliningrad region for organizing a sabotage community. One of them established a relationship with an SBU officer to commit arson and damage to property across Russia. The other assisted in finding candidates for sabotage acts. Both were charged with organizing and participating in a sabotage community.
original:
⚡️Two men were detained in the Kaliningrad region for organizing a sabotage community.

During the operational-search activities, it was established that one of the defendants established a relationship of confidential cooperation with an SBU officer, on whose instructions he created a sabotage community to commit arson of transport infrastructure facilities, communications equipment, and other damage to property on the territory of various constituent entities of the Russian Federation. His tasks included attracting new members of the sabotage community, distributing responsibilities between them, searching for objects of sabotage and organizing their execution.

The second suspect, having entered the said community of his own free will, assisted in the search for candidates to carry out acts of sabotage, as well as other actions facilitating their commission.

Both defendants were detained, the investigative department of the Federal Security Service of Russia in the Kaliningrad region opened a criminal case on the grounds of crimes under Part 1 of Art. 281.3. and part 2 of Art. 281.3 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (organization of a sabotage community and participation in it). The suspect was chosen as a preventive measure in the form of detention.👉Stay informed👇👇👇https://t.me/genicheskonlin

description: Since the beginning of the year, the Civil Registry Office departments of Crimea have issued 1951 marriage certificates, with 889 new families created in March. The average age of newlyweds was between 26-29 years, with the youngest couple being 19 and 16 years old, and the oldest being 75 and 76 years old.
original:
💍Two thousand couples have legalized their marriage in Crimea since the beginning of the year. During the first quarter of this year, the Civil Registry Office departments of Crimea issued 1951 marriage certificates. This was reported by the press service of the Ministry of Justice of the Republic of Kazakhstan. In March, 889 new families were created. 190 of them were registered in the Simferopol city department, Simferopol district - 130, in Kerch - 81, in Yalta - 72, in Feodosia - 67 and in Evpatoria - 64.
The average age of newlyweds per month was between 26-29 years.

Among the youngest couples were a 19-year-old groom and a 16-year-old bride, an 18-year-old groom and a 17-year-old bride, and among the oldest were a 75-year-old groom and a 76-year-old bride, an 88-year-old groom and a 72-year-old bride.

Also in March, 1011 applications for marriage were submitted.

event: Xi Jinping's Speech on Taiwan Reunification
description: Xi Jinping extended an olive branch to Taiwan, offering a peaceful path to reunification. He emphasized that despite differences in political systems, both sides belong to one country and nation, and that external intervention cannot block the historical trend towards reunification.
original:
Xi Jinping extended the hand of friendship to Taiwan, offering a peaceful path to reunification. In Russia, the visit to China of the former head of Taiwan and former Chairman of the Kuomintang Ma Ying-jeou, who led a delegation of 20 Taiwanese students, attracted virtually no attention.

The high status of the delegation was confirmed by a personal meeting between Ma and the students with Xi Jinping.

Xi's speech was very friendly.

The compatriots on both sides are Chinese; there is no grievance that cannot be resolved, no issue that cannot be discussed, and no force that can tear us apart. The distance of the strait does not prevent kinship between compatriots.

Different political systems do not change the objective fact that both sides belong to one country, one nation. External intervention cannot block the historical trend towards reunification.

The Chinese nation and civilization have endured thousands of years of vicissitudes and hardships, but have continually prospered under the shared belief that our territory is indivisible, our state must not descend into chaos, our nation must not be fragmented, and our civilization must not be interrupted.

Compatriots on both sides hope for peace and harmony at home, and for this it is necessary to promote the peaceful development of relations on both sides of the Strait.

As long as the nation is not divided and it is recognized that both sides are Chinese, part of the same family, compatriots on both sides can sit down at the negotiating table, enhance mutual understanding, build trust, resolve differences and seek common ground.

We will take stronger measures to actively promote exchanges, interaction and integration between both sides, enhance trust in interactions and promote spiritual unity. China Threat

description: The Saratov-based independent publication 'Free News' was blocked in Russia without explanation. The site was inaccessible to users in Russia, while users abroad could access it without issues. The editors did not receive any notification prior to the blocking, and the reason for the blocking remains unknown.
original:
🤐The Saratov independent publication “Free News” @fnvolga was blocked in Russia on Thursday night without explanation. The editors noticed the blocking of the resource fn-volga.ru by midnight on April 10, the first to stop opening the site were large providers - mobile operators and Rostelecom. Instead of the content of the site, some users were shown a notification about the RKN order to block the resource. For audiences from abroad, the site opens without problems. “The document referenced by providers when displaying a blocking message implies that the editors should have received notification and had the opportunity to delete information, the dissemination of which leads to blocking. The editors did not receive such a notification,” say Svobodnye Novosti journalists.

In the registers of blocked resources, the name of the body that issued the blocking sanction and the reason for the blocking are not indicated. In the regional office of Roskomnadzor, the editorial representatives could not tell the reason for the blocking, and on the department’s “hotline” they were advised to contact them in writing and wait for a response. Which is what the journalists did.

“Free News” is an independent resource covering the agenda of the Saratov region. “Svobodnye” are part of the Syndicate-100 - an association of about 20 independent editorial offices, created on the initiative of Novaya Gazeta in 2020 to coordinate the work of strengthening the voice of regional media in the face of unlimited propaganda resources.👉Telegram edition: @fnvolga

event: European Parliament Vote on Funding EU Council
description: The European Parliament deliberately failed to vote on funding the EU Council, demanding that European countries provide more air defense systems to Ukraine. The initiative, led by EP member Guy Verhofstadt, aims to secure 7 Patriot systems for Ukraine.
original:
The European Parliament deliberately failed the vote on funding the EU Council, calling on European countries to transfer more air defense systems to Ukraine.

The initiative was taken by EP member and former Prime Minister of Belgium Guy Verhofstadt from the Renew faction. He proposed removing the budget issue from the agenda until EU countries can find 7 Patriot systems for Ukraine.

“In my opinion, it is a scandal that Europe has an open door for Ukraine, and the European Commission is not even capable of searching for the most urgent things!” said Verhofstadt.

The decision was supported by 515 MEPs, 62 against.

The European Parliament postponed consideration of the issue of funding until the next session. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: Cadets participated in a practical 'Fire Training-2' lesson, which included memory exercises, setting up shooting positions, and dynamic transitions. They learned to hold targets while changing positions and practiced dashing and reducing silhouettes. The lesson was physically demanding but productive, and the cadets left feeling tired but happy.
original:
Forwarded from: NVP Rokot Bitsa
NVP Rokot Bitsa This Saturday (06.04_24), the “Fire training-2” lesson took place.
The contrast with a theoretical lesson in the classroom is like the difference between black and white😏However, everything is in order😌📌General gathering, light jogging to start blood circulation, distribution of training equipment, equipment, let's go!📌The first exercise was a memory exercise and the cadets did it It’s completely fine with him, they listed the rules for safe handling of weapons point by point. The first practical one was setting up the tab in statics with the formation of the whole body. It didn’t work out right away, not for everyone, but the guys tried and the result was not long in coming. Next, we alternately studied 2 other main positions for shooting: sitting and lying down, as well as with body posture and taking into account the nuances of anthropometry.

This is where the cream of the crop began😀The dynamic transition from the top floor to the bottom, and then back, requires a fairly high level of coordination, therefore attention, and with a constant increase in pace, it turned into quite a serious test😅😩📌A separate exercise should be considered a type of torture (after these circular changes of position) - statics.
Crooked, trembling hands - we learned to hold the target when changing positions, even when the brain refused (🤷‍♂️) to do this.🫡📌As we regained strength, we paid special attention to various types of dashing, the rules for reducing the silhouette and shifting upon contact.
Runs for 12/6/3/9 hours, with and without goal control, finally achieved the goals and objectives of the training!)

Tired, dirty, wet, but not broken and even VERY happy😃we discharged and cleaned our weapons, after which we went home to prepare for the next lesson🎼📻.

To everyone who took part, the administrators, instructors and cadets - a huge thank you for a well-coordinated and productive lesson, well done!)
It was cool.😎We are waiting for you to come to class. Join.Support us5336690177602143
Sergey B. OUR CHANNEL|OUR CHAT#NVP_Rokot_Bitsa#NVP_RokotBitsa_Ognevaya

description: Crews of Pacific Fleet corvettes 'Sovershenny', 'Gromky', and 'Hero of the Russian Federation Aldar Tsydenzhapov' conducted a joint artillery firing exercise at a Sea of Japan range. The exercise involved detecting and destroying mock enemy ships, helicopters, and floating mines, as well as simulating a missile attack using passive electronic jamming.
original:
The crews of the Pacific Fleet corvettes “Sovershenny”, “Gromky” and “Hero of the Russian Federation Aldar Tsydenzhapov” conducted joint artillery firing at one of the sea ranges in the Sea of Japan.
 
The corvettes were on alert after discovering an “enemy” detachment of ships. We set a course for the designated area to suppress the activities of the mock enemy.
 
During the approach, takeoffs of deck-based helicopters of the mock enemy were detected, which were destroyed from the A-190 artillery mount.
 
Next, the enemy attempted a retaliatory strike, and preemptive artillery fire was applied to the “enemy” ships. The personnel also set up passive electronic jamming to simulate a missile attack.
 
The exercise ended with firing from an AK-630M artillery mount at mock-ups of floating mines dropped from mock enemy ships.
 
Press service of the Eastern Military District
Video@TOF_VMF#perfect#loud#aldartsydenzhapov#tof#pacificfleet

event: US General Cavoli's Statement on Russia
description: US European Command Commander General Christopher Cavoli stated that Russia is a 'chronic threat' and that continued aid to Ukraine is crucial to counter the Russian invasion. He emphasized that without support, Ukraine will quickly run out of artillery shells and air defense missiles, leading to defeat.
original:
Forwarded from: Elena Panina
American General Cavoli: Russia is a “chronic threat” The commander of the US European Command, Christopher Cavoli, stated this on April 10 during a hearing in the US House of Representatives Committee on Armed Services.▪️According to Cavoli, “more than two years after the start of the invasion,” Putin is not showing no signs of readiness to stop hostilities. “Russia does not intend to stop at Ukraine,” the general said.

Cavoli formulated his concern about the reduction of American aid to Kyiv in the spirit of “Captain Obvious”: “If we do not continue to support Ukraine, it will quickly run out of artillery shells and air defense missiles. Based on my 37 years of experience in the US Armed Forces, if If one side can shoot and the other can't, then the side that can't shoot loses." Based on this Solomonic wisdom, Cavoli concludes that the stakes are very high—American leadership is at stake: "Our allies demand and hope for our continued leadership and an example [in the situation with Ukraine]."▪️Although this hand-wringing performed by Cavoli is not much different from the jeremiads of hundreds of Western officials and experts, the general, unlike them, is quite sincere. After all, Kavoli actually worries about the troops entrusted to him. It is the US European Command that is leading the military operations in Ukraine. The post of Supreme Allied Commander Europe, which Cavoli also holds, is a touching addition.

The General, using the simplest words of Captain Smollett's vocabulary, explains to lawmakers on Capitol Hill that without adequate supplies, he will not win the war against the Russians. Ukraine “remains almost completely dependent on external support. And if we do not continue to support it, it may lose.” That is, the United States may lose to Russia - this is how Mr. Cavoli should be understood. The main pain point of the American puppets in Kyiv has been known for a long time: Without foreign help, this junta will not last even a few months. Today, the issue of continued assistance has become a subject of intense political confrontation in the United States between the Democratic Party and the Republicans. But this is not enough. It is necessary to influence directly the United States in order to skyrocket their own costs from moderating the conflict in Ukraine.U.S. Department of DefenseU.S. Commander in Europe Says Russia Is a 'Chronic Threat' to WorldRussia poses a threat to the world and further aid to Ukraine to repulse the Russian invasion is crucial, the commander of U.S. European Command said.

description: A man was brutally beaten by unknown assailants in Yekaterinburg. The attackers, of non-Slavic appearance, used their hands, feet, and sticks to inflict severe injuries, including a broken nose, eye hemorrhage, and torn lip. The victim, who did not know the attackers, suspects they may have been trained militants.
original:
In Yekaterinburg, abu bandits mobbed a man who was simply going about his business.

The footage shows that unknown people, out of the blue, attack a person and begin to brutally beat him with their hands, feet and sticks. The beaten man has a bruise on his body, a broken nose, hemorrhage in his right eye, his left eye cannot open due to a bruise, his upper lip is torn and his ribs hurt. He also complained about minor memory problems: “For example, I remember my date of birth. And how many years - no, you need to take a calculator and calculate. They said that it would pass and that it would recover.” The victim claims that he did not know the attackers, but recognized two of them. Two of them came to his work asking him to fix his chainsaw. The man doesn’t understand why he was beaten. “We didn’t have any argument. I stood calmly on the street, talking on the phone. Then I only remember that they were already beating me. People clearly know each other. One sprayed pepper spray in the face, three kicked. In fact, we see the same trained militants as in Crocus City Hall. A man is knocked out with one blow, and he doesn’t even talk - he immediately strikes. And then people like them, for 500 thousand rubles, go and kill people. If they had
there was a weapon, I think they would have used it,” he shared on condition of anonymity.

Today he removed all the beatings and visited the forensic expert. “While I was with the investigator yesterday, a woman was sitting there. She said that her two sons were also beaten recently. One to one, the attackers were also of non-Slavic appearance,” said the victim.

description: Antonina Martynova, a woman who had been hiding from a verdict for 16 years, was detained by the police on March 22. She is accused of attempting to kill her two-year-old daughter in 2007.

The police detained a Novgorod woman who had been hiding from a verdict for 16 years in the case of an attempt on the life of her own daughter. Antonina Martynova (Fedorova) was detained on March 22, she is now in a pre-trial detention center. Her trial will resume on April 16.

Martynova is a defendant in the Novgorod case. According to investigators, in February 2007, she allegedly threw her two-year-old daughter Alice from the third floor. The woman insisted that the girl climbed over the fence herself, and she tried to save her.

In 2008, Martynova and her daughter disappeared just before the sentencing. Nothing was known about them all these years. The woman’s husband was Kirill Martynov* (he now holds the post of editor-in-chief of Novaya Gazeta. Europe**), to whom questions about their fate were periodically addressed.

description: A family from Orenburg, including Evgeniya and her husband, took refuge on the roof of an unfinished house in the Ivanovo settlement after their home was flooded. They set up a tent and camp stove, and are using gasoline generators to charge their phones. They are staying to protect their property from looters, despite the water level reaching 60 cm and continuing to rise.
original:
A family from Orenburg has been living in a tent on the roof of an unfinished house for three days. According to locals, employees of the Ministry of Emergency Situations have never come to their settlement since the beginning of the flood. About a thousand people lived in the Zarya SNT of the Ivanovo settlement. After the flood began, local resident Evgeniya and her husband pitched a tent right on the roof of an unfinished building opposite their flooded house. The children were evacuated and the animals were taken with them. Inside the tents there are two cots and a camp stove. Phones are charged with gasoline generators, things are dried on lines. A hole in the roof of the house, which is covered by a smaller tent, is used as a toilet.

The girl told the Beware News journalist that she and her husband were not going to leave the house because they were protecting their property from looters. Household appliances were wrapped in cellophane and lifted upstairs. But this did not help, the water in the house already reaches 60 cm and continues to rise. The refrigerator, washing machine and chest of drawers have already “surfaced”. At the same time, Evgenia says that in three days the rescuers never came to SNT “Zarya”. Their neighbors are helping them - they have set up a headquarters on the spot and are coordinating with the help of walkie-talkies. It is too early to assess what was saved. The whole kitchen will swell, so far we have only managed to save some small household appliances: a bread machine, a multicooker. The furniture needs to be disassembled. They saved what they could.

The ability to integrate our service with third-party systems through a program interface (REST API) allows for timely notification of users of Internet services, cloud platforms and internal corporate resources in the event of their data being compromised.

The API accepts phone numbers and email addresses as input. mail, logins and returns names of leaks, dates of leaks, passwords and names of fields included in leaks.

For companies that want to track employee data leaks, the API allows them to monitor all leaks within the corporate domain.

Quick notification of users, clients, and employees about the compromise of their accounts reduces the risks of successful hacker attacks on the company/service and fraudulent activities.

description: A Kharkiv man was exposed for fraud, selling non-existent goods online and defrauding almost 70 people. He posted ads for various items, requested advance payments, and then stopped contacting the buyers. The total material damage caused to the victims is approximately UAH 150,000.
original:
🔷"Sold" non-existent goods on the Internet and defrauded almost 70 people - a Kharkiv man was exposed for fraud Article 190 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

According to the investigation, throughout 2022, the man from Kharkiv posted on the website of free online classifieds advertisements for the sale of various items - household appliances, furniture, goods for children, musical instruments, etc.

When interested buyers responded to the ad, the man informed them of the need to transfer the advance payment to him and gave the bank card number. At the same time, he had no intention of sending the goods.

Being misled, the buyers agreed to the terms of the "seller" and transferred money to him, but immediately after that the attacker stopped contacting them.

At present, almost 70 people who were defrauded by the fraudster have been identified. The total amount of material damage caused to the victims is about UAH 150,000.

Currently, the question of selecting a preventive measure for the suspect is being resolved.

The pre-trial investigation is being conducted by the investigators of the VP No. 2 of the Khrupp No. 1 General Directorate of Public Security in the Kharkiv region.

Note: in accordance with Art. 62 of the Constitution of Ukraine, a person is considered innocent of committing a crime and cannot be subjected to criminal punishment until his guilt is proven in a legal manner and established by a court verdict. ⚔️Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

original:
Forwarded from: Novichkov ZaPraVdu
At the initiative of the co-chairman of the SRZP Party, my friend Zakhar Prilepin, a bill was developed on amendments to the Federal Constitutional Law “On the procedure for admission to the Russian Federation and the formation of a new subject of the Russian Federation within it.” The authors of the bill were my colleague, State Duma deputy Dmitry Kuznetsov.

The essence of the bill is that the admission into the Russian Federation of a foreign state or part of it is carried out regardless of the location of the borders of this foreign state, taking into account the sharing by the majority of citizens of this foreign state of the culture of Russia as the unique heritage of our people

That is, in this case, we are bringing the culture of Russia to the level of the civilizational foundations of our state, which means that recognition of the culture of Russia by citizens of foreign states is the basis for the accession of these states or their parts to Russia

description: The Ukrainian Rada approved a draft law on mobilization, introducing new provisions for military service. Key changes include a 60-day deadline for updating data in the TCC, mandatory military ID for men aged 18-60, and sanctions for non-compliance.
original:
Let us recall the main provisions of the draft law on mobilization, which the Rada today finally approved: 1. Those liable for military service are given 60 days from the date the law comes into force to update the data in the TCC - in person or electronically, at the choice of the conscript. For non-compliance there are fines and sanctions (more on them below). That is, if the law comes into force in mid-May, then the 60-day period will expire in mid-July.

2. The summons will be considered received even without being personally delivered to the person liable for military service: if the person was not found at home, then the date of “delivery” will be considered the day when the stamp indicating the impossibility of delivery is affixed.

3. Carrying a military ID will become mandatory not only for those liable for military service, but in general for all men aged 18 to 60 years. TCC employees, police and border guards will be able to check its presence.

The latter, among other things, means that even those men of the specified age who have the right to do so will not be allowed to go abroad without a military ID.

4. For violation of all these norms, a number of sanctions are provided: from fines (up to 22.5 thousand hryvnia) to deprivation of the right to drive a car and forcible drive to the TCC through the police (in case of failure to appear on a summons).

Fines are now being voted on in the Rada as a separate bill. Yesterday it was adopted in the first reading, excluding criminal liability for refusal to undergo a medical examination.

5. Almost all law enforcement agencies (for example, the full police force), assistants to deputies and owners of strategic enterprises (that is, essentially all large businessmen) were exempted from mobilization. Otherwise, the list of those booked remained approximately the same.

Among citizens, disabled people of all groups will receive a deferment (who will be forced to undergo re-certification once a year or more often). Disabled people of the third group were given a separate list of diseases for which they receive exemption (mainly either oncology or the absence of organs or limbs).

Also, the immediate relatives of disabled people will retain the deferment, but with a number of reservations, which we talked about here. After long discussions, graduate students were given a deferment, without division into the budget and the contract. It was retained by all students of full-time or dual forms of education who receive an education higher than the previous one.

But applicants for a second higher education were thus left without the right to a deferment.

The final version of the bill excludes the provision on the possibility of demobilization of military personnel after 36 months of service, which the authorities previously called one of the key points of the law. But the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine demanded that this paragraph be removed.

We looked at the bill on mobilization in more detail here. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"TelegramPolitics of the CountryThe Rada adopted in the second reading a bill on tightening mobilization. For - 283 people's deputies.

We wrote in detail about what this bill means here.VIEW MESSAGE

description: Alexey Navalny's memoirs, titled 'The Patriot', will be published in October, detailing his life and fight against the Russian dictatorship. The book, written in prison, will be released in 11 languages, including Russian, with an initial circulation of 500,000 copies.
original:
Alexey Navalny wrote memoirs about his life and the fight against the dictatorship in Russia. They will be published in October. The politician began writing his memoirs after his poisoning in 2020 and continued working on them in prison. The book, titled “The Patriot,” will be published in the United States by Knopf, writes The New York Times.

The first circulation will be 500,000 copies. The book will also be published in other countries.

According to the widow of the politician Yulia Navalnaya, the memoirs will be “the last demonstration of defiance” and could inspire Navalny’s followers. “Through the pages of the book, readers will get to know the man I deeply loved - a man of deep honesty and unshakable courage. Telling his story not only honors his memory, but will also inspire others to stand up for what is right and never lose sight of the values that truly matter,” she said. In her Twitter, Navalny noted that the book will be released on October 22 at 11 languages, including Russian.

The politician’s press secretary, Kira Yarmysh, said that Navalny, after his poisoning in 2020, dictated excerpts from the book to her, since at that time it was difficult for him to type on his own. “Then many times I heard people say about his posts from prison: “Alexey is like that.” He writes great, I wish he could write a book!” And I wanted to clap my hands and shout: “He’s writing! He's writing!" But we agreed to keep everything secret,” she wrote. Photo: TASS Subscribe to Dozhd’s Telegram Watch us on YouTube

event: Russian Foreign Ministry Response to Swiss Conference
description: Russian Foreign Ministry spokesperson M.V. Zakharova rejected the Swiss government's decision to hold a high-level conference on establishing peace in Ukraine, citing the conference's promotion of the 'Zelensky formula' and ignoring Russia's position. Zakharova stated that Russia will not participate in the conference, even if invited.
original:
🎙Response of the official representative of the Russian Foreign Ministry M.V. Zakharova to a media question about the decision of the Swiss government to hold a high-level conference on Ukraine❓ On April 10, the Swiss government announced the decision to hold a high-level conference on establishing peace in Ukraine in June 2024. Will Russia participate in it? M.V. Zakharova: We have repeatedly expressed an extremely negative attitude towards this “conference”. Russia will not take part in it, even if it receives an invitation, which we have not received.

Under the brand of “good offices”, Switzerland is trying to promote the compromised “Zelensky formula” and continue the failed “Copenhagen process”, only in a new package.☝️Any events that ignore Russia’s position and are based on the provisions of the ultimatum “Zelensky formula” are divorced from reality and hopeless.

The intention expressed by the organizers of the “conference” to isolate common components from the initiatives of other countries is nothing more than a trick. It is well known that the “Zelensky formula” does not imply compromises, alternatives and completely ignores the proposals of China, Brazil, African and Arab states.

There can be no trust in Switzerland either. It stands on the positions of Ukraine, supports the Kiev regime, applies anti-Russian sanctions, and adopts strategies that exclude Russia from the European security system. By definition, Switzerland cannot be a neutral receiving party, much less a mediator, in such conditions.

The West needs participation in the “conference” of the countries of the Global South only to give weight to a certain “collective ultimatum” that they are going to present to Russia. We hope that our partners in Asia, Africa and Latin America will be vigilant and will not allow themselves to be drawn into another anti-Russian adventure.

event: Attack on Trypillya Thermal Power Plant
description: A combined attack by a Geranium UAV and cruise missiles targeted the Trypillya thermal power plant in the Kyiv region on April 11. The strike had severe consequences, causing a massive fire that spread throughout the turbine hall, likely due to the use of reserve fuel. The plant is now shut down and unlikely to return to operation, significantly reducing the reliability of Ukraine's energy system.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
On the morning of April 11, a combined attack by a Geranium UAV and cruise missiles was carried out on the Trypillya thermal power plant in the Kyiv region.

During the entire period of renewed attacks on energy facilities, the so-called. There were no arrivals from Ukraine at the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant, as well as at some other large stations - for example, the Dobrotvorskaya Thermal Power Plant.

The blow to the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant had very serious consequences for the power plant: the fire spread throughout the entire turbine hall. Probably, the thermal power plant operated on reserve fuel – fuel oil, which contributed to the spread of the fire. A fire is also visible on one of the generator transformers.

Judging by the scale of the fire, there is nothing left to restore in the turbine room. Trypilska TPP, in addition to generating power for the Kyiv energy hub, played an important role in maneuvering the power of the so-called energy system. Ukraine using a fast-controlled turbogenerator.

The station is currently shut down and is unlikely to return to operation. Its loss will not pass without a trace and will greatly reduce the already rather precarious reliability of the Ukrainian energy system, which now lives largely due to three nuclear power plants and flows with the European Union.

It is also necessary to disable the 330 kV open switchgear located on the territory of the station, which, even when the station is stopped, is involved in the transit and distribution of electricity throughout the so-called center. Ukraine.@rybar

description: Türkiye proposed a draft peace treaty to Zelensky and Putin, outlining several key commitments. These include a mutual non-use of nuclear weapons, non-interference in internal affairs, freezing the war along the current front line, and holding referendums in 2040. The treaty also guarantees Ukraine's non-bloc status until 2040 and allows for Ukraine's accession to the European Union.
original:
Türkiye offers Zelensky and Putin a draft of a new peace treatyThe draft treaty involves:

- A mutual commitment by the United States and Russia to not use nuclear weapons under any circumstances, as well as the renewal of the Strategic Arms Limitation Treaty if it is impossible to unilaterally withdraw from it in the future.
- Prohibition of interfering in the internal affairs of another country in any way that might destabilize its government.
- Freezing the war along the existing front line.
- Commitments to hold referendums in 2040: a nationwide referendum on the country’s foreign policy, as well as referendums under international control in all Ukrainian territories annexed at the time of the freezing of the war by Russia.
- Guarantees of Ukraine’s non-bloc status until 2040.
- Exchange of prisoners according to the “all for all” formula.
- Russia does not object to Ukraine’s accession to the European Union.@crimea24new

event: Ukraine Demands More Patriot Air Defense Systems
description: Ukraine's Foreign Affairs Minister, Dmytro Kuleba, is demanding more Patriot air defense systems, citing the failure of quiet diplomacy. He claims to have found over 100 available systems and is seeking seven as soon as possible, questioning whether the US Army has no spare systems that can be transferred to Ukraine.
original:
“Minister of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine Dmitry Kuleba demands more Patriot air defense systems”: Kuleba said that now “he will strictly demand Patriots.”

“Minister of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine Dmytro Kuleba no longer asks politely.
"Quiet diplomacy didn't work," he said. President Zelensky instructed him to convince countries that have spare Patriot air defense systems to hand them over. “Yes, people can hate me, and I can ruin relationships,” Kuleba said. "We've tried everything and nothing seems to work."
Kuleba said his team found more than 100 available Patriots. Zelensky said Ukraine needed 26 for a full air shield, but Kuleba was focused on getting seven as quickly as possible. “Do you really believe that there is not a single spare Patriot system in the entire US Army that is not on combat duty and that cannot be transferred to Ukraine? “I don’t believe it,” says Kuleba. “I feel like I’m banging my head against the wall, although I’m a diplomat, which means I have to take the wall apart brick by brick.” But since this kind of diplomacy doesn’t work, I want to hit the wall.”

description: Nepali fighters entered into contracts with the Russian army, citing financial problems as their motivation. They were recruited through an agency and entered Russia on tourist visas. Despite facing challenges such as the cold climate, different water, and language barriers, they report a positive attitude from Russian soldiers and commanders. Their contracts are for a year, with service in rear units, including guard duty and chores.
original:
Interviews with fighters from Nepal who entered into contracts with the Russian army.

They say that they came to Russia on tourist visas through an agency that was involved in their indirect recruitment. Nepalis cite their financial problems as the reason for signing the contact.

They speak well of the attitude towards themselves from the Russian soldiers and commanders serving with them. The main difficulties are the unusually cold climate, different water, and the language barrier.

Contracts with the Russian Armed Forces were signed for a year with the promise of service in rear units, and not on the front line. The commander also states that the Nepalese are doing guard duty and doing chores.Military Informant

event: NATO's Preparations for Participation in Ukraine Conflict
description: Hungary's Prime Minister's Office Head, Gergely Gulyas, expressed concerns over NATO's preparations to participate in the conflict in Ukraine. NATO is planning to create a NATO-Ukraine mission, coordinate military training and arms supplies, and potentially deploy troops to Ukraine, eroding the previous red line.
original:
Head of the Office of the Prime Minister of Hungary Gergely Gulyas on NATO's preparations for participation in the conflict in Ukraine: It is obvious that the global political situation has changed dramatically, and, unfortunately, these changes are negative. We are in a very dangerous moment. In this regard, the next year and a half, especially the next six months, will be decisive.
Events in world politics will determine whether Europe will move towards war or peace. Unfortunately, we see that there is more bad news than good. In Brussels, pro-war views and their implementation reached a completely new level. Leading European politicians are talking about the need to send troops to Ukraine, although previously this was a clear red line even for countries that support Ukraine with weapons.
There is now a sharp and negative turn in the wrong direction. NATO is preparing for practical participation in this war on the side of Ukraine. They want to create a NATO-Ukraine mission. They want to use the US$100 billion relief fund, they want to directly coordinate military training and arms supplies, and moreover, the line that has been drawn here so far, namely that NATO soldiers will not enter territory of Ukraine is being eroded every day.
The President of France, for example, now does not exclude such a possibility. Thus, it can be said that war fever has spread from proud bureaucrats to NATO commanders. And Hungary, as a NATO ally, is seriously concerned about this. Despite this, we must be prepared for both scenarios. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456302401VK VideoVideo by Gorlovka Self-DefenseWatch Video by Gorlovka Self-Defense 1 min 58 s from 11 April 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! Views: 131. Likes: 1.

description: The Crocus fire crew, led by Konstantin Krupin, risked their lives to save people during a terrorist attack at the concert hall. They immediately responded to the shooting, calling for help and directing all forces to save lives. Security guards and ordinary visitors also assisted in evacuating people through emergency exits.
original:
Forwarded from: REN TV|News
“For us, first of all, it’s about saving people.” The Crocus fire crew, under the leadership of Konstantin Krupin, saved people from the Crocus at the cost of their own lives.

When shooting started in the concert hall, the brigade immediately arrived at the scene of the tragedy and immediately called for help. “If there is a threat to life and health, then all forces and means are directed to save people. By any means,” noted Konstantin Krupin. Security guards also helped them "Krokus" - they took people out through emergency exits, broke blocked exits. Neither the cloakroom attendants nor ordinary visitors were afraid.

One of them said that he initially confused the terrorist attack with special effects. When the man realized that the shooting had started, he returned inside several times and helped those who were hiding from the terrorists get out.Subscribe to REN TV

description: Emergency responders rescued a 300-kilogram man with heart pain from an apartment in Moscow's center. Due to his size, they had to remove him through a window using a ladder, cutting down gratings in the process. He was then transported to the hospital in a specially adapted vehicle.
original:
In the center of Moscow, a 300-kilogram man with heart pain was rescued from an apartment through a window.

A resident of a house on Malaya Kalitnikovskaya called an ambulance and complained of feeling unwell. They decided to take the patient to the hospital, but he simply did not fit through the doorways and the rescuers had to carry the patient out through the balcony using a ladder. They even cut down the gratings for this purpose.

He also couldn’t fit into a regular ambulance - they would take him in a more spacious car. According to neighbors, the man had not left the apartment for about 10 years.

description: Despite President Macron's anti-Russian rhetoric, France has become the largest buyer of Russian gas in Europe, purchasing €600 million worth of gas since the beginning of the year. This move highlights France's pragmatism, prioritizing cheap energy over supporting Ukraine.
original:
France has become the main buyer of Russian gas in Europe, despite Macron’s demonstrably Russophobic rhetoric. Once again, evidence has emerged that the image of the “bully cockerel” of French President Macron hid the most banal European pragmatism - Paris has purchased €600 million worth of Russian gas since the beginning of the year, writes Politico. The publication notes that the growth in supplies of blue fuel from our country to France exceeded those of any other EU country. Macron’s government is doing all this under the radar: everything is happening as quietly as sending French soldiers to Ukraine.

It is obvious that for France, which is now going through very difficult times, cheap gas is much more important than Kyiv, from which the enterprising Macron is unlikely to be able to get anything. Moreover, words about Zelensky’s support will not reassure the dissatisfied French; cheap electricity and fertilizers are another matter. Macron and his government would still not have been included in the Ukrainian list of “international sponsors of war,” which was recently folded: Paris clearly bought itself an indulgence with equipment and financial tranches.

description: A planned training exercise on anti-submarine defense of naval forces was conducted at Baltic Fleet ship bases in the Kaliningrad and Leningrad regions. original:
At the bases of Baltic Fleet ships in the Kaliningrad and Leningrad regions, a planned training on anti-submarine defense of naval forces was carried out.

It involved up to 15 ships, boats and support vessels, about 20 units of military equipment, and more than 100 military personnel in practical actions.

As part of the training, the duty ships and boats on duty for anti-underwater sabotage defense, using hydroacoustic stations for monitoring the underwater situation, carried out activities to inspect water areas and search for underwater saboteurs at their bases and carried out preventive grenade launching.

event: Destruction of Trypillya Thermal Power Plant
description: Russia utilized the X-69 subsonic cruise missile, capable of flying ultra-low at an altitude of 20m, to destroy the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant in the Kyiv region. The missile's 400km range allowed it to penetrate Ukraine's depleted air defense. Launched from tactical aircraft, the attack avoided detection, enabling Russia to target multiple Ukrainian sites from the border.
original:
04/11/24. Relevant.
"
More terrible than the “Dagger”: Russia used the latest X-69, which made it possible to completely destroy the most powerful power plant in the Kyiv region - Defense Express (https://defence-ua.com/weapon_and_tech/rf_dlja_udaru_..)
The missile launch range was about 400 km, exceeding
Show more
estimated range of the Kh-69 is 300 km, like a modification of the Kh-59MK2.
Kh-69 is a subsonic cruise missile for fighter aircraft. The main feature is the ability to fly ultra-low at an altitude of 20 m, which is lower than the X-101 can do.
A successful strike on the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant indicates the possibility of a missile penetrating through the obviously depleted air defense.
Launching from tactical aircraft erases the characteristic feature of large-scale missile attacks, when the takeoff of Tu-95MS strategic bombers and MiG-31K interceptors is recorded in advance.
A range of 400 km will make it possible to hit many Ukrainian targets from fighter jets that can fly up to the border at 50-70 km.
The map shows options for launch areas. If the Russian Aerospace Forces launch them from Belarus, then the entire Ukraine will be included in the affected area, except for the Transcarpathian region.”

description: Iran is planning an attack on Israeli territory, but faces a significant challenge in penetrating Israel's air defense and missile defense systems. To guarantee success, Iran may need to increase the number of missiles and drones involved, but risks rapid escalation and damage to its reputation if the attack is repelled or weakened.
original:
Forwarded from: Atomic Juche
Regarding the expected Iranian attack on Israeli territory, discussed everywhere.

Israel still has a small territory, and therefore very tightly covered and covered by air defense and missile defense systems. And these systems are fully operational and combat-ready.

Therefore, there is a serious problem for Iran's planners.

On the one hand, it is necessary to reliably penetrate Israel’s air defense and missile defense systems. Therefore, it is necessary to plan for losses to overcome. And to guarantee success, increase the number of missiles and drones involved. And increase this matter to a very serious scale.

On the other hand, we must not go too far. And not to strike so sweepingly and effectively and spectacularly that a rapid escalation begins.

Thirdly, if Israeli air defense and missile defense repulses or radically weakens the strike, this will ricochet on Iran’s reputation. Therefore, the risk of screwing up is high if you rely too much on the quality of missiles and drones, and at the same time, incorrectly assess the combat effectiveness of air defense and missile defense systems.

How will this contradiction be resolved, and how successfully?

Let's see.#offtopic

event: Purchase of Turnstiles for National Guard Military Hospital
description: The National Guard military hospital purchased 'Dnipro' turnstiles for UAH 51 million, despite concerns from combat medics about their poor quality. The tender was criticized for being biased towards the manufacturer, with 'Sich Ukraine' offering a lower bid of 46 million UAH for their SICH Tourniquet, which is recommended by combat medics and tactical medicine instructors.
original:
A few days ago, the National Guard military hospital purchased "Dnipro" turnstiles for UAH 51 million. Many combat medics consider them to be of poor quality. In total, three companies participated in the tender: "Kyiv Commerce Group", "Sich Ukraine" and "Prostir Production Company". As a matter of fact, the latter is manufactured by Dnipro turnstiles.

The use of "Dnipro" is advised by the public organization "Turnstile Testing Center", which was created at the initiative of the Ministry of Health. However, there is a question for them, if only because one of the founders of CTT works for the turnstile manufacturer "Dnipro".

Another participant in the tender — the company "Sich Ukraine" — took part in the bidding with an offer of 46 million UAH. It manufactures the SICH Tourniquet, which is recommended by combat medics and tactical medicine instructors. "SICH Tourniquet" is currently considered the only reliable Ukrainian tourniquet, which is not inferior to foreign analogues.

Tacmed instructor Maria Nazarova believes that the tender was held "under the manufacturer's rule", because only Dnipro meets some of the technical requirements for turnstiles. "Sich" has a metal handle, but no clip; the SAT has a clip, but the handle is plastic," the instructor wrote.

event: Reliability Test of PP-2000 Submachine Gun
description: Rostec conducted a series of reliability tests on the PP-2000 submachine gun, including throwing it onto ice, rolling it in mud, and immersing it in dirty water. The most challenging test involved colliding it with a passenger car, covering it in mud, but it still fired uninterruptedly.
original:
Forwarded from: Lomovka
The PP-2000 submachine gun passed a record shooting test with dirt inside. Rostec published a video of various reliability tests being carried out on the weapon.

Testers forcefully threw the PP-2000 onto the ice from a height of one meter or more, including with the barrel down, rolled in the mud, and immersed it in dirty water. However, it continued to work each time, allowing it to accurately hit targets.

The submachine gun was also tested with continuous firing. More than 400 rounds were fired from it and it never misfired.

The most difficult test for the weapon was a collision with a passenger car, which pressed the PP-2000 into the greasy clay mud so much that it could not be immediately found. The submachine gun, covered in mud and with clay in the receiver, barrel and mechanisms, still continued to fire uninterruptedly.

PP-2000 was developed by the Instrument Design Bureau of the High-Precision Complexes holding, which is part of Rostec.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

A little more than 30 residents out of almost 100 thousand who inhabited the city in 1940 met the liberators. Kerch was awarded the title of Hero City, and 137 soldiers were awarded the title of Hero of the Soviet Union,” the parliamentarian said. He noted that the horrors of the occupation did not break the spirit of the Kerch residents. Part of the Soviet troops descended into the Adzhimushkai quarries. The warriors of the underground garrison fought the enemy for 170 days and nights. “We know the names of 2.5 thousand Defenders. The names of the 260 “Adzhimushkais” who survived are also known. Almost all of them went through captivity. The feat of the Adzhimushkaya Defenders is a moral “scale” for all of us. The main thing is for us to remember them,” Konstantinov added. event: Adoption of Draft Law on Mobilization

The document will help to verify data on conscripts and minimize the risks of abuse in the process of obtaining a deferral or reservation. description: The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted Law No. 10449, which amends certain legislative acts regarding military service, mobilization, and military accounts. The law aims to support the Ukrainian military's efforts to achieve victory.
original:
On April 11, the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine at its plenary session adopted in its second reading and in its entirety Law of Ukraine No. 10449 "On Amendments to Certain Legislative Acts of Ukraine Regarding Certain Issues of Military Service, Mobilization, and Military Accounts." 283 People's Deputies voted "for".

During the adoption of the law in the session hall of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine, the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umerov, the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Colonel-General Oleksandr Syrskyi, the Chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Major-General Anatoliy Bargylevych, and the Commander of the Joint Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, General- Lieutenant Yuriy Sodol.

During his speech, the Commander of the United Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Lieutenant General Yuriy Sodol, called on the people's deputies to adopt the latest version of draft law No. 10449: "I am sure that you and I share one goal - to win. The Armed Forces and other military formations are doing everything to ensure that we get this victory as soon as possible. I ask you to vote for the latest version of the law. The Armed Forces will not let the entire Ukrainian people down."

The press service of the Apparatus of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine noted that during the preparation of the draft law for the second reading, 4,195 amendments and proposals were received from the subjects of the law of legislative initiative within the period specified by Article 116 of the Regulations of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine. The comparative table to the draft law contains 4,294 amendments and proposals, of which: 31 were taken into account, 4,263 were rejected.

According to the regulations and the Constitution of Ukraine, the document must be signed by the Speaker of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine and handed over to the President of Ukraine for signature.

After the signature of the President of Ukraine, the law enters into force a month later.

description: Russian forces shelled the location of the 128th OGSHBr formation in the fall of 2023, killing over 30 soldiers. The attack was allegedly facilitated by criminals accessing Signal through a phishing email and intercepting messages with an access code.
original:
Signal: Tips for Safe Use Using Signal? This messenger is called one of the most secure — it uses end-to-end encryption, meaning only the sender and receiver can read each other's messages.

But criminals are constantly trying to steal data from there or learn valuable information. Example: the enemy, through a phishing e-mail and access to Signal, could learn about the location of the formation of the soldiers of the 128th OGSHBr in the fall of 2023. Then Russian shelling killed more than 30 soldiers. How can criminals break into your Signal? Through a lost phone and its owner's account. If the phone number is known to criminals, they can intercept messages with an access code using specialized equipment. Instead, share the link or QR code on your profile. Through the document and the desktop version: if you download and open the file, criminals will be able to secretly install malicious software using vulnerabilities in other software, for example, office file viewers. Next, monitor your screen, microphone and take screenshots. So do not download or open unknown files, especially from unknown recipients. And if you use the desktop version, be sure to install an antivirus. Pretend to be a support service and ask to send sensitive data, allegedly to verify the owner of the account .Important: even if you follow the recommendations above, you can never guarantee 100% safety, because there are factors that are difficult to influence. For example, a few years ago, Signal had a bug — the application sent random images from the gallery to contacts. Molfar

description: Roscosmos head Yuri Borisov discussed the preparations for the launch of the new Angara-A5 heavy rocket, emphasizing the importance of rigorous testing to ensure reliability. The launch is part of the first stage of flight testing of the Amur space rocket complex.
original:
“This is not a television show and not the launch of festive fireworks”: the head of Roscosmos, Yuri Borisov, spoke about how the preparations for the launch of the new Angara-A5 heavy rocket went. For us, it was a difficult three days, because this is not a television show and not launching festive fireworks. This is routine, hard work. We have started the flight design tests, which are designed to identify all the shortcomings, all the nuances, and ensure reliability in the future during serial launches of the Angara. This is only the fourth launch of the heavy Angara in ten years. The rocket has not yet reached the required level of readiness, this is a natural process. This is a new cosmodrome and a completely new, automatic launch,” Borisov said in an interview with the Rossiya 24 TV channel.

The head of Roscosmos noted that employees of the state corporation still have a lot of work to do to improve the rocket to ensure its reliability.

The Angara launch took place as part of the first stage of flight testing of the Amur space rocket complex, which includes the launch vehicle itself and the entire infrastructure of the cosmodrome.

Today, Angara-A5 launched the small satellite Gagarinets into orbit. And in 2028, a manned spacecraft should be launched into space using a launch vehicle.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Defeat of Estonian Unmanned Ground Tracked Platform
description: A Russian FPV drone successfully defeated the Estonian unmanned ground tracked platform THeMIS Cargo. The THeMIS platform, developed by Milrem Robotics, is a remotely controlled robotic complex with a modular structure, allowing for international cooperation with companies like MBDA, EOS, and ST Engineering.
original:
The defeat of the Estonian unmanned ground tracked platform THeMIS Cargo by a Russian FPV drone.

The remote-controlled robotic complex THeMIS is the flagship project of the Estonian company Milrem Robotics. However, the Estonian origin of the combat vehicle should not make anyone laugh or mislead, since the project has an open modular structure and is being implemented in the broadest international cooperation, for example, with companies such as MBDA, EOS, ST Engineering, Nexter, Kongsberg and FN Herstal.

Structurally, THeMIS is a remotely controlled platform on tracks, which has a length of 2.4 m with a width of 2 m and a height of 1.11 m. Ground clearance - up to 60 cm, platform weight - 1630 kg, payload - 750 kg (maximum 1200 kg ). The power plant is hybrid: the robot is equipped with a diesel engine and an electric generator. All the main components and assemblies of the Estonian robot are located in the side housings, and most of them are located inside the tracks. The central platform, which has no internal volumes, is intended for the installation of various devices, instruments, weapons and other modules.

description: The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted amendments to the mobilization law, removing the clause on demobilization. Citizens have 2 months to update their data in the TCC, and dodgers will face legal consequences, including the loss of driving privileges and consular services. The law also introduces the mobilization of vehicles if a citizen owns two or more cars, which will be used to support infantry brigades.
original:
​​The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted further amendments to the law on mobilization. As expected, the clause on demobilization was completely removed - it will not happen. Citizens are given 2 months to update data in the TCC (in fact, this term hides voluntary surrender to the army). Dodgers will be legally deprived of the right to drive a vehicle (except for a number of cases when this is a source of income or necessary to care for a disabled person) and receive consular services. All those with limited fitness are now required to undergo a medical examination again.

An amendment was also adopted on the mobilization of a vehicle if a citizen has two or more cars. It is worth noting here that such a measure is quite logical - passenger cars (sedans, pickups, etc.) will become the basis for already created and created infantry brigades. Nowadays, in videos published by the Russian military, this type of transport is increasingly being captured during the rotation of personnel to positions or the delivery of ammunition and food, because Armed Forces armored vehicles are suffering catastrophic losses.

description: Russian Anatoly Shchetinin, a 26-year-old native of Khakassia, was detained by Russian military police officers in Armenia. He claimed to have decided to return to Russia after learning that his case for leaving his unit without permission was closed. However, he is being held at the 102nd military base in Gyumri.
original:
A Russian who deserted from the army was detained in Armenia. He stated that he himself decided to return to Russia after learning that his case was closed. But he is not being released from Armenia✹ On April 9, Armenian human rights activists from the Vanadzor branch of the Helsinki Civil Assembly (HCA) reported that Russian military police officers detained Russian Anatoly Shchetinin and took him to the 102nd military base in Gyumri.

✹ The morning after the arrest, human rights activists arrived at the military base - expert of the Public Verdict Foundation Hasmik Novikova and lawyer of the Center for International Defense Narek Hakobyan. Odanko, a Russian, told human rights activists that he did not need any help.

✹ “Important Stories” found out that Shchetinin is 26 years old and a native of Khakassia. As Mediazona writes, from the leaked databases it follows that Shchetinin lived in Kamchatka and could serve under a contract in the 155th Marine Brigade.

✹ At the same time, Shchetinin is in the wanted database of the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs, Mediazona found out. It is unknown under what crime he is wanted. Shchetinin himself, in a conversation with human rights activists at a military base, said that a case had been opened against him for leaving his unit without permission, but now it is allegedly closed.

✹ An acquaintance of Shchetinin, with whom Mediazona spoke, recalls that he came to Yerevan about six months ago and lived illegally. He also says that Shchetinin wanted to return to Russia and went to the embassy several times, “because he simply didn’t have money for a ticket,” but they didn’t help him there.

✹ In his conversation with human rights activists at the military base, Shchetinin said that the day before they had already tried twice to take him out of Armenia by military plane, but the flight was not allowed.

✹ Head of the KhSA Artur Sakunts says that the Armenian border service banned travel. According to him, the refusal is due to the fact that Shchetinin is wanted in Russia. In order for him to be released, permission from the Minister of Justice of Armenia is required.

event: Issuance of Electronic Certificates for Combat Veterans
description: The Russian Ministry of Defense has begun issuing electronic certificates for combat veterans in the Lugansk People's Republic. Veterans can obtain these certificates by presenting their passport and military veteran certificate at a partner bank. The certificates are also being issued to military personnel performing combat missions at checkpoints and in rear areas.
original:
Military personnel of units of groupings of troops of the Russian Armed Forces, performing combat missions to protect the civilian population of Donbass, issued the first electronic certificates of veterans of military operations in the area of military operations
The Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation continues to issue
Show more
electronic ID of a combat veteran. Together with a partner bank, work has been organized on the registration and issuance of electronic certificates for combat veterans in the new territory of the Russian Federation in the Lugansk People's Republic.
“To obtain an electronic identification card for a combat veteran, a veteran of the military operations simply needs to come to any partner bank on the territory of the Russian Federation and submit an application for this certificate, presenting a passport and a military military veteran certificate on paper. If the veteran does not have a paper certificate, then he only needs to present a certificate of participation in the SVO. Such certificates are issued by the personnel authorities of any military unit that takes part in the military military unit,” said Lieutenant General Yuri Kuznetsov, head of the Main Personnel Directorate of the RF Ministry of Defense.
The right to receive an electronic ID was given to military veterans who took part not only in the Northern Military District, but also in other armed conflicts and operations, including in Syria, in the Chechen campaigns, in the war in Afghanistan, etc.
Also, the Russian Ministry of Defense organized work on issuing electronic VBD certificates for military personnel performing combat missions at checkpoints in the area of military operations and in rear areas.
The registration and issuance of electronic UBD certificates is carried out by special mobile offices created on the basis of cars.
Such special transport allows you to issue and issue electronic IDs in remote or hard-to-reach locations, including in the forward and rear areas of the Northern Military District, as well as in military hospitals where military personnel undergo treatment and rehabilitation. You can issue and receive an electronic ID both inside a specially equipped salon and on the premises of the hospital, including in the wards.

description: An analysis of court decisions revealed that Russian military personnel involved in the war in Ukraine had their sentences commuted in 57% of cases for criminal offenses. Over two years, war veterans received more than 2.5 thousand sentences, with most being punished more leniently than civilians.
original:
“Novaya Gazeta Europe”: Russian military personnel had their sentences commuted in 57% of cases for criminal offenses. Over two years, war veterans in Ukraine received more than 2.5 thousand sentences in criminal cases. More often than half of the cases, they were mitigated due to “participation in the SVO.” This was found out by Novaya Gazeta Europe by analyzing the database of court decisions. Since the beginning of the war, at least 2,605 former and current participants have become accused of criminal charges. Moreover, in the majority - 57% - of cases, they are punished much more leniently than civilians - despite the fact that officially participation in the war is not included in the list of mitigating circumstances of the case. In 2023, the number of sentences for war participants increased seven times, and the number of violent crimes - 13 times; If the cause of the crime is the attitude of the victims towards the war, this may also be considered a mitigating circumstance; Unauthorized abandonment of a military unit is the most popular article under which war participants are prosecuted. Since the beginning of the invasion, courts have handed down 1,392 verdicts on it. Most of the convicts received real sentences. Desertion is also severely punished - deserters are sentenced to up to 15 years in prison; The only crime for which military personnel are judged more harshly than civilians is trafficking in explosives.

By December 2023, as Siren calculated, 51 people had become victims of former military personnel. Infographics: New newspaper Europe Subscribe to Dozhd's Telegram Watch us on YouTube

description: Soldier Dmytro Matviychuk, call sign Fanta, died on September 13, 2023, in the Bakhmut direction of Donetsk region, after receiving a fatal gunshot wound to the head while performing a combat mission. He was a brave warrior who had previously survived a sniper's direct hit and continued fighting.
original:
​​💔Soldier Dmytro Matviychuk, call sign Fanta, died on September 13, 2023 in the Bakhmut direction of Donetsk region. While performing a combat mission, he received a fatal gunshot wound to the head. The defender is forever 25.

Dmytro comes from the city of Berdychiv, Zhytomyr region. He graduated from the Berdychiv Vocational College of Industry, Economics and Law. After graduation, he immediately went to work. He worked at various enterprises in his hometown, later he went to work in Lithuania.

When the full-scale war began, the man was in Europe, but decided to return to defend his Motherland. He did not wait for the summons, so he himself went to the military commissariat. Subsequently, Dmytro joined the ranks of the 3rd OShBr. He underwent training and assumed the position of gunner of the machine gun department. Together with the unit, he went to defend Bakhmut. During his service, he was awarded the "Golden Cross" award of the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

During one of the vacations, the young warrior married his beloved.

"My husband was always brave, always wanted to go first and never wanted to miss a single assault. He survived a sniper's direct hit in his helmet and within a few minutes he loaded his machine gun and continued the fight," Valeriya Matviychuk said.

The stormtrooper was buried in his hometown. Dmytro is survived by his parents, sister, brother, wife, relatives, friends and brothers. Ukrainian Truth together with the Memorial platform honor the memory of fallen soldiers

event: Regional Target Programs for Luhansk Residents
description: Regional target programs were implemented in Luhansk to address social needs, allocating 256.9 million hryvnias to 8 programs in 2023. The majority of funding came from the regional budget (81%) and local budgets (9.3%). The largest allocation, 254.7 million hryvnias, was spent on social programs.
original:
More than 250 million: almost all the funds under the regional programs of 2023 were directed to the social needs of Luhansk residents.

Regional target programs are one of the effective tools for complex solutions to the issues of preserving and reviving the potential of the region lost due to the war.

Thus, 256.9 million hryvnias were allocated to the implementation of 8 out of 13 programs that operated throughout 2023. The main source of financing was the funds of the regional budget (81% of the total amount) and local budgets (9.3%).

The largest amount of funds - UAH 254.7 million. spent on social programs.

In the current year, the implementation of a number of active regional programs ends, so the prospects for the development of new and active ones for the new period were also discussed.

The results of the implementation of regional target programs for 2023 can be found at the link.

description: A fake document claiming to be from Roskomnadzor prohibited media from photographing military personnel and equipment in the Orenburg region due to flooding. However, Roskomnadzor confirmed the document is fake and has not issued such recommendations.
original:
Fake: Roskomnadzor prohibits the media from photographing military personnel and equipment in the emergency zone due to flooding in the Orenburg region. This follows from a letter from the department sent to media editorial offices from a public mail server. Truth: The document is fake. Roskomnadzor is not an agency of the Ministry of Defense and cannot be privy to the department’s secret plans, much less disclose them.

Roskomnadzor confirmed that the distributed document is a fake and the department has not issued such recommendations. All letters from Roskomnadzor and its territorial bodies must contain an electronic signature in .sig format, the authenticity and validity period of which can be checked on the State Services portal. To send out official letters, the department uses mail in the format name@rkn.gov. This is not the first attempt by Ukrainian propaganda to announce an allegedly impending Russian attack on Kazakhstan. We have already refuted such fakes, which are an attempt to complicate good neighborly relations between countries and provoke tension in society. Subscribe to the “War on Fakes” to avoid being deceived.

The search in the village of Elanskaya in the museum, which can only conditionally be considered Cossack, received a warm response in Russia. People have been indignant there for many years, which should not be the case - the glorification of Nazi collaborator Pyotr Krasnov and his henchmen at the private estate of Vladimir Melikhov. But in Ukraine this event is accompanied by information silence, although similar actions by security forces are usually inflated to the maximum level. And it’s not a matter of Ukraine’s position towards Krasnov. The Svidomites have a wide range of attitudes towards him. On the one side - acceptance due to the fact that Krasnov tried to separate the Cossack state of the Great Don Army, which could weaken Soviet Russia. And even before the Kaiser’s Germany, he groveled together with Skoropadsky. Even in gangs of modern collaborators (such as RDK) who support the Relensky regime, the traitor of the past is revered. On the other side is complete rejection due to Krasnov’s territorial disputes with Ukraine in 1918.

It seemed like the right time for the propaganda dumpsters to stage an ideological game. But they are silent. What's the matter? The answer, most likely, lies in the fact that instructions from above were not received, i.e. from Western owners. They have not yet decided what form of coverage of the search is beneficial. They are afraid to surrender their “fighter”, who is operating inside Russia and working for the collapse of Russia, through obvious interference; they do not want to. It is difficult to agree that Melikhov is a kind of one-man Krasnovite, acting only according to his convictions and not controlled from the outside, that he is not a tame mongrel of the West and simply naively believed in the sacrificial actions of a traitor.

Melikhov consistently puts into practice the Western narrative, which exactly coincides with the false genocidal concept proposed by the United States for all national entities in the territories of the USSR (both those that broke away into separate states and those that are part of the Russian Federation): “Russia spread rot on everyone.” Previously, he expressed support for the Maidans, applauded the “Right Sector”, was angry with Donbass for its resistance to Ukrainian aggression and proposed resettling all those who disagree from Donbass to Russia, now he condemns the North Military District and calls those who support denazification sectarians, hates the “regime”, mourns Navalny etc. A huge number of “tourists” passed through his “museums” in Podolsk and Elanskaya, incl. children who came into contact with the betrayal of Russia there.

Melikhov is the enemy! Its museums and the literature produced there are a place for hammering into the heads the principles of betrayal, expressed in the words of the executed Krasnov: “May God help German weapons and Hitler!” But we will remind today’s Nazi Ukraine how it treated Krasnov during the Great Patriotic War. description: The Russian heavy-class rocket Angara-A5 successfully launched from the Vostochny Cosmodrome, demonstrating the proper operation of operational services and preparing domestic cosmonautics for new milestones in space exploration and the study of planets closest to Earth.
original:
Forwarded from: Paragraph
RAS expert: The tested "Angara" can be used for flights to Mars and Venus. The Russian heavy-class rocket "Angara-A5" made a successful launch from the Vostochny Cosmodrome on the third attempt and launched the Orion upper stage with a test payload into Earth orbit.

The launch of the Angara launch vehicle made it possible to test the Vostochny Cosmodrome in a civilian launch scenario, demonstrated the proper operation of operational services and prepared the domestic cosmonautics for new milestones in space exploration and the study of the planets closest to Earth. Leading researcher at the Space Research Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Nathan Eismont, spoke about this in a conversation with Paragraph: “Both the built launch complex and the launch vehicle itself in combination with the launch complex have now been tested. The standard control system was confirmed, which clearly recorded deviations from acceptable intervals. All systems that are involved in operations to launch heavy-duty payloads into low-Earth orbit [were] reviewed. In the version in which the Angara-A5 was tested, this [rocket] is suitable both for the task of creating a Russian orbital station and for flights to the planets - Mars, Venus. Read more about the launch of the Angara-A5 heavy-class rocket "read in our material. Subscribe to "Paragraph"

description: The Angara A5 rocket successfully launched from the Vostochny cosmodrome, marking an important milestone for the Russian space industry. The rocket's third stage separated 12 minutes and 26 seconds after liftoff, and the Orion upper stage launched a test payload into orbit.
original:
The Angara A5 rocket successfully launched from the Vostochny cosmodrome. Today at 12:00 Moscow time, the Angara-A5 heavy-class rocket launched for the first time from the Vostochny cosmodrome. 12 minutes 26 seconds after liftoff, the Orion upper stage separated from the rocket's third stage and began launching a test payload into orbit.

Initially, the launch of the Angara-A5 was planned for April 9, but 2 minutes before the launch the automation shut down due to a failure of the pressurization system for the oxidizer tank of the central block of the rocket. A repeat attempt on April 10 was also unsuccessful - this time a failure of the engine start control system prevented it, as reported by the head of Roscosmos, Yuri Borisov.

Until today, there have been three launches of the light Angara-A1.2 (the first in 2014) and three launches of the heavy Angara-A5 from the Plesetsk cosmodrome in the Arkhangelsk region. In the future, it is planned to launch from Vostochny the modernized Angara-A5M, which will launch modules of the Russian orbital station into orbit.

The successful launch of Angara-A5 from the new cosmodrome is an important step for the Russian space industry, demonstrating the expansion of capabilities for launching payloads into orbit using domestic heavy-class launch vehicles.📹RoscosmosMAXimum of aviation:Telegram&MAKS-2024Souvenirs&Clothing for those in love with the sky

description: The FSB declassified documents revealing the mass executions of over 1,000 civilians by the Nazis in the Smolensk region in 1941. original:
Entire families were shot in Smolyan: evidence of Nazi crimes was declassified. The FSB declassified documents on the mass executions of civilians by the Nazis in the Smolensk region. Shocking data about the execution of more than a thousand people on the outskirts of the city in 1941 has been published for the first time. Also preserved in the archive is a special message from Soviet counterintelligence that Smolensk residents were shot by families “on the slightest suspicion.”

All materials were transferred to the State Archive of the Smolensk Region as part of the project “Without a Statute of Limitations.” During two years of occupation, the population in the Smolensk region decreased by half.

description: Contrary to initial reports, Iran's Permanent Mission to the UN did not announce its readiness to refrain from responding to the Israeli strike on the Iranian consulate in Damascus. Instead, the mission stated that if the UN Security Council condemned the Israeli authorities' actions and held them accountable, Iran's need to punish the regime would be eliminated. However, since this opportunity has been lost, Iran will not back down from punishing the Zionist regime.
original: We recently discussed the issue with Sergei Mardan, but decided to double-check (before this there was no such opportunity, and I did not publish anything on this topic). So, everyone writes that the Permanent Mission of Iran to the UN announced Tehran’s readiness to refuse to respond to the Israeli strike on the Iranian consulate in Damascus, if the UN Security Council condemns the actions of the Israeli authorities. But this is an automatic - and incorrect - translation of the post from the page of the permanent mission on the social network X (formerly Twitter). The construction “might have” in English has the following meaning: the situation is over, but the action itself was not committed, although it could. There is even a noun - “a might-have-been”, which translates as “loser” (that is, a person who could have been someone, but didn’t). This word is also used as an adjective, then the meaning is “unfulfilled.” If we translate the Iranian post taking into account the above, this is what we get. If the UN Security Council condemned the act of aggression of the Zionist regime against the Iranian diplomatic premises in Damascus and subsequently attracted responsibility for those responsible, the need for Iran to punish this rogue regime would be eliminated. But now the opportunity has been lost - and, therefore, Iran will not refuse to punish the Zionist regime. That is, the post, which is translated as proof of Iran's readiness to back down, actually has the opposite meaning.
